basic.description: This course explores the electrostatic field-Gauss's law; boundary conditions; capacitance; Laplace's and Poisson's equations; energy, forces, and torques. The steady electric current. The magnetostatic field-vector potential; Amper's and Biot-Stavart laws; inductance, energy, forces and torques. Quasistatic fields; electromagnetic induction.
basic.subject: EEL
basic.title: Electromagnetic Fields I

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: EEL 3112, MAP 2302 or MAP 3305, MAS 3105 or MAP 3306, and PHY 2049C.
